anchor:

positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Ratio and Proportion

positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Geometry

positive: General Aptitude: Verbal Ability - Grammar and Sentence Structure

anchor: A circular sheet of paper is folded along the lines in the directions shown. The paper, after being punched in the final folded state as shown and unfolded in the reverse order of folding, will look like __________ .
positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Spatial Aptitude

__________ is to surgery as writer is to __________.

positive: General Aptitude: Verbal Ability - Verbal Analogies

anchor: We have 2 rectangular sheets of paper, M and N, of dimensions 6 cm x 1 cm each. Sheet M is rolled to form an open cylinder by bringing the short edges of the sheet together. positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Mensuration and Geometry

anchor:
Details of prices of two items P and Q are presented in the table. The ratio of cost of item P to cost of item Q is 3:4. Discount is calculated as the difference between the marked price and the selling price. The profit percentage is calculated as the ratio of the difference between selling price and cost, to the cost (Profit % = ((Selling price - Cost) / Cost) * 100). The discount on item Q, as a percentage of its marked price, is __________.
| Items | Cost (₹) | Profit % | Marked Price (₹) |
|---|---|---|---|
| P | 5,400 | --- | 5,860 |
| Q | --- | 25 | 10,000 |
positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Percentage, Profit, and Loss

anchor: There are five bags each containing identical sets of ten distinct chocolates. One chocolate is picked from each bag. The probability that at least two chocolates are identical is __________.
positive: General Aptitude: Numerical Ability - Probability

positive: General Aptitude: Verbal Ability - Logical Deduction

anchor: Consider a linear list based directory implementation in a file system. anchor: Consider a computer system with a byte-addressable primary memory of size 2³² bytes. Assume the computer system has a direct-mapped cache of size 32 KB (1 KB = 2¹⁰ bytes), and each cache block is of size 64 bytes. The size of the tag field is __________ bits.
positive: CS - Computer Organization and Architecture: Memory Hierarchy - Direct-Mapped Cache Address Translation

anchor: A relation r(A, B) in a relational database has 1200 tuples. The attribute A has integer values ranging from 6 to 20, and the attribute B has integer values ranging from 1 to 20. Data bits: |d₈|d₇|d₆|d₅|d₄|d₃|d₂|d₁| -> |1|1|0|x|0|1|0|1|
Check bits: |c₈|c₄|c₂|c₁| -> |y|0|1|0|

• M₁ uses priority of execution for the processes as, P₁ > P₃ > P₂ > P₄, i.e., P₁ and P₄ have highest and lowest priorities, respectively.
• M₂ uses priority of execution for the processes as, P₂ > P₃ > P₄ > P₁, i.e., P₂ and P₁ have highest and lowest priorities, respectively.
A process Pᵢ is scheduled to a processor Mₖ, if the processor is free and no other process Pⱼ is waiting with higher priority. At any given point of time, a process can be allocated to any one of the free processors without violating the execution priority rules. Ignore the context switch time.
